props.name: library
props.description:
The library instance to render API docs for.
Defaults to getting from library_context.

props.name: tome
props.description:
The tome for the API docs page.

props.name: minimal

Used when the API index is shown on a parent docs page.

props.name: module_path
props.description: The module path parameter from the route (e.g., "lib/Button.svelte").

props.description:
The library instance to render API docs for.

The tome for the API docs page.

props.name: path

props.name: selected_path

Prefixed with a slash and relative to the base path.
`null` means none and `undefined` is detected from the current url.

props.name: base_path
props.description:
Sets a custom base path of `path` and `selected_path`.
Defaults to `base` from `$app/paths`.

declarations.name: create_context
declarations.doc_comment:
Wraps Svelte's `setContext` and `getContext` for better ergonomics.
When no value is set in the context,
`get` throws an error and `get_maybe` returns `undefined`.
If a `fallback` is provided, the `value` argument to `set` is optional
and `get_maybe` is omitted from the type.
declarations.type_signature: <T>(fallback: () => T): { get: () => T; set: (value?: T | undefined) => T; }
declarations.return_type: { get: () => T; set: (value?: T | undefined) => T; }

declarations.name: contextmenu_is_valid_target
declarations.doc_comment: Returns true if valid and narrows the type to HTMLElement | SVGElement.
declarations.type_signature: (target: EventTarget | null, shiftKey: boolean): target is HTMLElement | SVGElement

declarations.name: contextmenu_calculate_constrained_y
declarations.type_signature: (menu_y: number, menu_height: number, layout_height: number): number

members.type_signature: (menu: SubmenuState | RootMenuState, run: () => ContextmenuRun, disabled?: () => boolean): EntryState

Creates a `contextmenu` store.

If an initial layout is provided, control is deferred externally.
Otherwise the layout syncs to the page dimensions.

parameters.name: params

declarations.name: contextmenu_open
declarations.doc_comment:
Opens the contextmenu, if appropriate,
querying the menu items from the DOM starting at the event target.
declarations.type_signature: (target: HTMLElement | SVGElement, x: number, y: number, contextmenu: ContextmenuState, options?: ContextmenuOpenOptions | undefined): boolean

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: the leaf element from which to open the contextmenu

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: the page X coordinate at which to open the contextmenu, typically the mouse `pageX`

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: the page Y coordinate at which to open the contextmenu, typically the mouse `pageY`

parameters.name: contextmenu
parameters.description: the contextmenu store

parameters.name: options

declarations.return_description: a boolean indicating if the menu was opened or not

declarations.type_signature: { get: () => Dimensions; set: (value?: Dimensions | undefined) => Dimensions; }

declarations.name: contextmenu_check_global_root
declarations.doc_comment:
Registers a contextmenu root and warns if multiple non-scoped roots are detected.
Only active in development mode. Automatically handles cleanup on unmount.

parameters.name: get_scoped
parameters.description: Getter function that returns the current scoped value

declarations.name: ContextmenuRoot
declarations.doc_comment:
Touch event handler for tap-then-longpress bypass detection.

This allows users to access the native context menu by performing a tap
followed by a longpress/rightclick within a specified time window.
The bypass gesture is useful for accessing browser features like text selection
or the native context menu when the Fuz contextmenu would normally override it.

Note: preventDefault is not called as we're only observing touch patterns,
not intercepting them. The actual bypass happens in on_window_contextmenu.

props.name: contextmenu
props.description:
The `contextmenu` prop is not reactive because that's a rare corner case and
it's easier to put the `contextmenu` directly in the context
rather than wrapping with a store or other reactivity.
If you need to change the contextmenu prop for some reason, use a `{#key contextmenu}` block:
https://svelte.dev/docs#template-syntax-key

props.name: open_offset_x
props.description:
The number of pixels to offset from the pointer X position when opened.
Useful to ensure the first menu item is immediately under the pointer.

props.name: open_offset_y
props.description:
The number of pixels to offset from the pointer Y position when opened.
Useful to ensure the first menu item is immediately under the pointer.

props.name: bypass_with_tap_then_longpress
props.description:
Whether to detect tap-then-longpress to bypass the Fuz contextmenu.
This allows access to the system contextmenu by tapping once then rightclicking/long-pressing.
Setting to `false` disables the gesture.

props.name: bypass_window
props.description:
The number of milliseconds between taps to detect a gesture that bypasses the Fuz contextmenu.
Used only when `bypass_with_tap_then_longpress` is true.
If the duration is too long, it'll detect more false positives and interrupt normal usage,
but too short and some people will have difficulty performing the gesture.

props.name: bypass_move_tolerance
props.description:
The number of pixels the pointer can be moved between taps to detect a tap-then-longpress.
Used only when `bypass_with_tap_then_longpress` is true.

props.name: scoped
props.description: If `true`, wraps `children` with a div and listens to events on it instead of the window.

props.name: link_entry
props.description:
Snippet for rendering link entries.
Set to `null` to disable automatic link detection.
Defaults to `link_entry_default` which renders `ContextmenuLinkEntry`.

props.name: text_entry
props.description:
Snippet for rendering copy text entries.
Set to `null` to disable automatic copy text detection.
Defaults to `text_entry_default` which renders `ContextmenuTextEntry`.

props.name: separator_entry
props.description:
Snippet for rendering separator entries.
Set to `null` to disable automatic separator rendering.
Defaults to `separator_entry_default` which renders `ContextmenuSeparator`.

declarations.name: ContextmenuRootForSafariCompatibility
declarations.doc_comment:
Blocks the next click event. Set to true when a longpress completes to prevent
iOS's synthesized click from activating the first menu item.

props.name: contextmenu
props.description:
The `contextmenu` prop is not reactive because that's a rare corner case and
it's easier to put the `contextmenu` directly in the context
rather than wrapping with a store or other reactivity.
If you need to change the contextmenu prop for some reason, use a `{#key contextmenu}` block:
https://svelte.dev/docs#template-syntax-key

props.name: longpress_move_tolerance
props.description: The number of pixels the pointer can be moved without canceling `longpress`.

props.name: longpress_duration
props.description: The number of milliseconds after a touch starts before opening the Fuz contextmenu.

props.name: bypass_with_tap_then_longpress
props.description:
Whether to detect tap-then-longpress to bypass the Fuz contextmenu.
This allows access to the system contextmenu by tapping once then long-pressing.
Setting to `false` disables the gesture.

props.name: bypass_window
props.description:
The number of milliseconds between taps to detect a gesture that bypasses the Fuz contextmenu.
Used only when `bypass_with_tap_then_longpress` is true.
If the duration is too long, it'll detect more false positives and interrupt normal usage,
but too short and some people will have difficulty performing the gesture.

props.name: bypass_move_tolerance
props.description:
The number of pixels the pointer can be moved between taps to detect a tap-then-longpress.
Used only when `bypass_with_tap_then_longpress` is true.

props.name: open_offset_x
props.description:
The number of pixels to offset from the pointer X position when opened.
Useful to ensure the first menu item is immediately under the pointer.

props.name: open_offset_y
props.description:
The number of pixels to offset from the pointer Y position when opened.
Useful to ensure the first menu item is immediately under the pointer.

props.name: scoped
props.description: If `true`, wraps `children` with a div and listens to events on it instead of the window.

props.name: link_entry
props.description:
Snippet for rendering link entries.
Set to `null` to disable automatic link detection.
Defaults to `link_entry_default` which renders `ContextmenuLinkEntry`.

props.name: text_entry
props.description:
Snippet for rendering copy text entries.
Set to `null` to disable automatic copy text detection.
Defaults to `text_entry_default` which renders `ContextmenuTextEntry`.

props.name: separator_entry

Snippet for rendering separator entries.
Set to `null` to disable automatic separator rendering.
Defaults to `separator_entry_default` which renders `ContextmenuSeparator`.

props.name: icon_button

declarations.name: csp_trusted_sources_of_ryanatkn
declarations.doc_comment: Trusted sources owned by ryanatkn.

declarations.name: create_csp_directives
declarations.doc_comment:
This is designed for compatibility with SvelteKit
and maps to the `KitConfig` `directives` option.
The goal is to provide an ergonomic, modern, and safe API
for Content Security Policy (CSP) creation
that's simple to write and audit, and isn't error-prone.

Things like validation and rendering to a string
are out of scope and left to SvelteKit.

properties.name: directives
properties.doc_comment:
Override or transform specific directives.
Returning `null` or `undefined` from a transform function will remove the directive.

properties.name: trusted_sources
properties.doc_comment: Sources to include based on their trust levels.

properties.name: value_defaults
properties.doc_comment:
Override default values for specific directives,
merging with `value_defaults_base` (or replacing if that directive is null in the base).

properties.name: value_defaults_base
properties.doc_comment:
Base values for directive defaults.
Set to `null` or `{}` to start with no defaults.
Defaults to `csp_directive_value_defaults`.

properties.name: required_trust_defaults
properties.doc_comment:
Override trust requirements for specific directives,
merging with `required_trust_defaults_base` (or replacing if that directive is null in the base).

properties.name: required_trust_defaults_base
properties.doc_comment:
Base values for directive trust requirements.
Set to `null` or `{}` to start with no trust requirements.
Defaults to `csp_directive_required_trust_defaults`.

declarations.name: csp_trust_level_value
declarations.doc_comment:
Numeric values for CSP trust levels, `csp_trust_levels`.
Lower is less trusted.
Includes `undefined` in the type for safety.

declarations.name: CspTrustLevel
declarations.doc_comment:
Trust levels for CSP sources.

With the base defaults, trust levels roughly correspond to:

- `low` â€“ Passive resources only (no script execution, no styling or UI control).
		Examples: `img-src`, `font-src`.
- `medium` â€“ Content that may affect layout, styling, or embed external browsing contexts,
   but cannot directly run code in the page's JS execution environment or
		perform other high-risk actions. Examples: `style-src`, `frame-src`, `frame-ancestors`.
- `high` â€“ Sources that can execute code in the page's context or open powerful network
   channels. Examples: `script-src`, `connect-src`, `child-src`.
- `null` â€“ No trust. This is used for directives that don't support sources.

declarations.name: parse_csp_trust_level
declarations.doc_comment: Validates and extracts a CSP trust level from an unknown value.

declarations.name: is_csp_trusted
declarations.doc_comment:
Determines if a granted trust level is sufficient to satisfy a required trust level.

Trust levels have the following hierarchy:
- 'high' sources can be used in high, medium, and low trust directives (highest privilege)
- 'medium' sources can be used in medium and low trust directives
- 'low' sources can only be used in low trust directives (lowest privilege)
declarations.type_signature: (required_trust: "low" | "medium" | "high" | null | undefined, granted_trust: "low" | "medium" | "high" | null | undefined): boolean

declarations.name: csp_directive_value_defaults
declarations.doc_comment:
The base CSP directive defaults.
Prioritizes safety but loosens around media and styles, relying on defense-in-depth.
Customizable via `CreateCspDirectivesOptions.defaults`.
declarations.type_signature: Record<keyof CspDirectives, boolean | (CspSource | CspActionSource)[] | CspSources | CspFrameSource[] | string[] | "script"[] | ("allow-downloads-without-user-activation" | ... 11 more ... | "allow-top-navigation-by-user-activation")[] | null>

declarations.name: csp_directive_required_trust_defaults
declarations.doc_comment:
Sources that meet this trust requirement are included for it by default.
If null, no trusted sources are added to the directive automatically.
Directives that don't support sources or default to `['none']` are null.

Feedback is welcome, please see the issues - https://github.com/fuzdev/fuz_ui/issues

declarations.name: csp_directive_specs
declarations.doc_comment:
Static data descriptors for the CSP directives.
Fuz excludes deprecated directives, so those are intentionally omitted,
but any newer missing directives are bugs.

Could be moved to `csp.ts` but is currently here to keep that module smaller.

props.name: hash
props.description: URL fragment to append, with or without the `#`.

declarations.name: Details
declarations.doc_comment: Like `details` but renders children lazily by default.

props.name: eager
props.description:
Children are lazily rendered by default,
enabling transitions and improving performance, sometimes significantly.
Pass `true` to render children eagerly to gain
`ctrl+f` functionality while trading away the benefits.
Consider a `<details>` element instead of making this component eager.

modules.module_comment: Like `details` but renders children lazily by default.

props.name: index
props.description: index 0 is under 1 is under 2 etc -- the topmost dialog is the last in the array

props.name: content_selector
props.description:
If provided, prevents clicks that would close the dialog
from bubbling past any elements matching this selector.

declarations.name: to_dialog_params
declarations.doc_comment:
This helper function is needed to construct `DialogParams` with type safety.
It uses TypeScript's inferred generics for functions,
which do not work for plain objects as of v5.0.4.
* `ContextmenuParams` uses a similar strategy.
declarations.type_signature: <T extends Component<any>>(Component: T, props: ComponentProps<T>, dialog_props?: Partial<Record<string, any>> | undefined): DialogParams<T>

declarations.name: DialogParams
declarations.doc_comment:
This pattern is based on:
https://github.com/ivanhofer/sveltekit-typescript-showcase/blob/main/src/01-props/09-svelte-component/Component.svelte
The main limitation is that the generic cannot be inferred automatically,
so we use `to_dialog_params` to construct instances in most cases.
Definining `DialogParams` with no concrete `T` lacks typechecking for `props`.

declarations.name: docs_slugify
declarations.doc_comment:
Convert a string to a URL-safe fragment identifier, preserving case for API declarations.
Only transforms spaces and special characters, keeping valid identifier characters intact.
Used for hash anchors in documentation.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: The string to convert to a fragment

declarations.type_signature: (path_slug: string, pathname: string, root_path?: string): { path: string; path_is_selected: boolean; path_segment: string | undefined; }
declarations.return_type: { path: string; path_is_selected: boolean; path_segment: string | undefined; }

declarations.name: docs_links_context
declarations.type_signature: { get: (error_message?: string | undefined) => DocsLinks; get_maybe: () => DocsLinks | undefined; set: (value: DocsLinks) => DocsLinks; }

members.name: add
members.type_signature: (fragment: string, text: string, pathname: string, tag?: DocsLinkTag | undefined, depth?: number, parent_id?: string | undefined, explicit_id?: string | undefined): string

members.name: generate_section_id
members.doc_comment:
Generate a unique section ID for the current page render.
This counter is instance-scoped, ensuring SSR/client consistency.

props.name: hash
props.description: URL fragment to append, with or without the `#`.

props.name: module_count
props.description: Total number of modules.

props.name: declaration_count
props.description: Total number of declarations.

props.name: filtered_module_count
props.description: Number of modules after filtering.

props.name: filtered_declaration_count
props.description: Number of declarations after filtering.

props.name: path
props.description: GitHub path - can be a full URL or a relative path like `owner/repo` or `owner/repo/blob/main/file.ts`

props.name: hash
props.description: URL fragment to append, with or without the `#`.

props.name: size
props.description: Sets both the `width` and `height` of the svg. Overridden by the `width` and `height` props.

props.name: width
props.description: Sets the `width` of the svg. Overrides `size`.

props.name: height
props.description: Sets the `height` of the svg. Overrides `size`.

properties.name: onintersect
properties.doc_comment: Called when the element enters or leaves the viewport until disconnected.

properties.name: ondisconnect
properties.doc_comment:
Called when the attachment's observer is disconnected,
either by the user calling disconnect or the attachment being destroyed.

properties.name: count
properties.doc_comment:
A value of `1` disconnects after `el` enters and leaves the viewport one time,
similar to 'once' for an event.
`0` disables and `undefined` or a negative number like `-1` never disconnects.

properties.name: options
properties.doc_comment:
Same as the `options` param to
[`IntersectionObserver`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IntersectionObserver/IntersectionObserver#options)

declarations.name: intersect
declarations.doc_comment:
Creates an attachment that observes element viewport intersection.
Uses the lazy function pattern to optimize reactivity:
callbacks can update without recreating the observer, preserving state.

parameters.name: get_params
parameters.description: Function that returns callback, params object, or nullish to disable

declarations.name: LibraryGenOptions
declarations.doc_comment: Options for Gro library generation.

properties.name: source
properties.doc_comment:
Module source options for filtering and path extraction.

Can provide full `ModuleSourceOptions` or partial options that will be
merged with defaults. The `project_root` is automatically set to
`process.cwd()` if not provided.

properties.name: on_duplicates
properties.doc_comment:
Callback invoked when duplicate declaration names are found.

Consumers decide how to handle duplicates: throw, warn, or ignore.
Use `throwOnDuplicates` for strict flat namespace enforcement.

declarations.name: source_file_from_disknode
declarations.doc_comment:
Convert Gro's Disknode to the build-tool agnostic SourceFileInfo interface.

Use this when you want to analyze files using Gro's filer directly.

throws.description: if disknode has no content (should be loaded by Gro filer)

declarations.name: library_collect_source_files_from_disknodes
declarations.doc_comment:
Collect source files from Gro disknodes, filtering BEFORE conversion to SourceFileInfo.

This avoids errors from files outside source directories (like test fixtures that may
have malformed paths or missing content). The filtering uses `isSource` which
checks `source_paths` to only include files in configured source directories.
declarations.type_signature: (disknodes: Iterable<Disknode>, options: ModuleSourceOptions, log?: { info: (...args: unknown[]) => void; warn: (...args: unknown[]) => void; } | undefined): SourceFileInfo[]

parameters.name: disknodes
parameters.description: Iterator of Gro disknodes from filer

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Module source options for filtering

parameters.name: log
parameters.type: { info: (...args: unknown[]) => void; warn: (...args: unknown[]) => void; } | undefined
parameters.description: Optional logger for status messages

declarations.name: library_gen
declarations.doc_comment:
Creates a Gen object for generating library metadata with full TypeScript analysis.

This is the Gro-specific entry point. It handles:
- Reading files from Gro's filer
- Loading package.json via Gro utilities
- Analyzing source with svelte-docinfo (pure analysis)
- Wrapping with LibraryJson (GitHub/npm metadata)
- Returning output in Gro's Gen format

For build-tool agnostic usage, use `analyze` directly.

Usage in a `.gen.ts` file:

```ts
import {library_gen} from '@fuzdev/fuz_ui/library_gen.js';

export const gen = library_gen();
```

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Optional generation options

declarations.name: url_api_declaration
declarations.doc_comment: Build project-relative API documentation URL with hash anchor.

parameters.name: declaration_name
parameters.description: Name of the declaration to link to

declarations.name: url_api_declaration_full
declarations.doc_comment: Build full API documentation URL with domain and hash anchor.

parameters.name: homepage
parameters.description: Package homepage URL

parameters.name: declaration_name
parameters.description: Name of the declaration to link to

declarations.name: url_api_module
declarations.doc_comment: Build project-relative module documentation URL.

parameters.name: module_path
parameters.description: Module path (e.g., 'helpers.ts')

declarations.type_signature: (homepage_url: string | null, logo_path?: string | undefined): string | null

declarations.name: url_to_root_relative
declarations.doc_comment:
Convert a full URL to root-relative format by removing the origin.

Uses SvelteKit's page state for the current origin by default.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Full URL to convert

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Origin to strip (defaults to current page origin)

modules.module_comment:
Library documentation URL helpers.

Runtime UI helpers for building URLs in the library documentation system.
These depend on fuz_ui's documentation paths and SvelteKit's runtime state.

For generic package/repository URL helpers, see `package_helpers.ts`.

declarations.name: LibraryOutputResult
declarations.doc_comment:
Result of generating library output files.
Contains both the JSON data and the TypeScript wrapper file.

properties.name: json_content
properties.doc_comment: JSON content for library.json

properties.name: ts_content
properties.doc_comment: TypeScript wrapper content for library.ts

declarations.name: library_generate_output
declarations.doc_comment:
Generate the library.json and library.ts file contents.
Parses at generation time so runtime only needs the pre-computed result.

Returns JSON + .ts wrapper because:
- JSON is natively importable by Node.js and Vite without TypeScript loaders
- Works in CI environments that don't have TS compilation
- The .ts wrapper validates with zod and exports with proper types
  (JSON imports get widened types like `string` instead of literal unions)
declarations.type_signature: (package_json: { [x: string]: unknown; name: string; version: string; private?: boolean | undefined; description?: string | undefined; motto?: string | undefined; glyph?: string | undefined; logo?: string | undefined; ... 23 more ...; exports?: string | ... 2 more ... | undefined; }, source_json: { ...; }): LibraryOutputResult

parameters.name: package_json
parameters.type: { [x: string]: unknown; name: string; version: string; private?: boolean | undefined; description?: string | undefined; motto?: string | undefined; glyph?: string | undefined; logo?: string | undefined; ... 23 more ...; exports?: string | ... 2 more ... | undefined; }

parameters.name: source_json
parameters.type: { [x: string]: unknown; name: string; version: string; modules?: { [x: string]: unknown; path: string; declarations?: { [x: string]: unknown; name: string; kind: "function" | "type" | "variable" | "class" | "constructor" | "component" | "json" | "css"; ... 20 more ...; alias_of?: { ...; } | undefined; }[] | undefine...

declarations.name: Library
declarations.doc_comment:
Rich runtime representation of a library.

Wraps `LibraryJson` with computed properties and provides the root
of the API documentation hierarchy: Library â†’ modules â†’ declarations

declarations.name: MdzComponents
declarations.doc_comment:
Component registry for custom Svelte components that can be used in mdz content.

For example, registering 'Alert' allows using `<Alert>...</Alert>` in mdz content.

The Map values are the Svelte component constructors.

declarations.name: MdzElements
declarations.doc_comment:
Element registry for HTML elements that can be used in mdz content. For example, registering 'div' allows using `
...
` in mdz content. The Map values are boolean placeholders for future configuration options.

Context for providing custom mdz components.
Must be set by the application using mdz.

Context for providing allowed HTML elements.
Must be set by the application using mdz.
By default, no HTML elements are allowed.

declarations.name: mdz_to_svelte
declarations.doc_comment:
Converts an array of `MdzNode` to a Svelte markup string.

Each node type produces output matching what `MdzNodeView.svelte` renders at runtime.
Collects required imports and flags unconfigured component/element references.
declarations.type_signature: (nodes: MdzNode[], components: Record<string, string>, elements: ReadonlySet<string>): MdzToSvelteResult

parameters.name: nodes
parameters.description: Parsed mdz nodes to render.

parameters.name: components
parameters.description:
Component name to import path mapping (e.g., `{Alert: '$lib/Alert.svelte'}`).
If content references a component not in this map, `has_unconfigured_tags` is set.

parameters.name: elements
parameters.description:
Allowed HTML element names (e.g., `new Set(['aside', 'details'])`).
If content references an element not in this set, `has_unconfigured_tags` is set.

modules.module_comment:
Converts parsed `MdzNode` arrays to Svelte markup strings.

Used by the `svelte_preprocess_mdz` preprocessor to expand static `<Mdz content="...">` usages
into pre-rendered Svelte markup at build time. The output for each node type matches what
`MdzNodeView.svelte` renders at runtime, so precompiled and runtime rendering are identical.

declarations.name: mdz_parse
declarations.doc_comment: Parses text to an array of `MdzNode`.

declarations.name: MdzParser
declarations.doc_comment:
Parser for mdz format.
Single-pass lexer/parser with text accumulation for efficiency.
Used by `mdz_parse`, which should be preferred for simple usage.

members.name: parse
members.doc_comment:
Main parse method. Returns flat array of nodes,
with paragraph nodes wrapping content between double newlines.

modules.module_comment:
mdz - minimal markdown dialect for Fuz documentation.

Parses an enhanced markdown dialect with:
- inline formatting: `code`, **bold**, _italic_, ~strikethrough~
- auto-detected links: external URLs (`https://...`) and internal paths (`/path`)
- markdown links: `[text](url)` with custom display text
- inline code in backticks (creates `Code` nodes; auto-linking to identifiers/modules
  is handled by the rendering layer via `MdzNodeView.svelte`)
- paragraph breaks (double newline)
- block elements: headings, horizontal rules, code blocks
- HTML elements and Svelte components (opt-in via context)

Key constraint: preserves ALL whitespace exactly as authored,
and is rendered with white-space pre or pre-wrap.

## Design philosophy

- **False negatives over false positives**: Strict syntax prevents accidentally
  interpreting plain text as formatting. When in doubt, treat as plain text.
- **One way to do things**: Single unambiguous syntax per feature. No alternatives.
- **Explicit over implicit**: Clear delimiters and column-0 requirements avoid ambiguity.
- **Simple over complete**: Prefer simple parsing rules over complex edge case handling.

## Status

This is an early proof of concept with missing features and edge cases.

modules.module_comment:
Package and repository URL helpers.

Generic utilities for building URLs and parsing package/repository metadata.
These functions have no framework dependencies and can be used at build-time or runtime.

URL builders:
- `url_github_file` - GitHub file permalink
- `url_github_org` - GitHub organization page
- `url_npm_package` - npm package page
- `url_well_known` - .well-known metadata file

Parsers:
- `repo_url_parse` - extract repo URL from package.json repository field
- `repo_name_parse` - extract repo name from scoped package name
- `repo_url_github_owner` - extract GitHub owner from repo URL

Predicates:
- `package_is_published` - check if package is published to npm

Component import mapping for mdz content.
Key: component name as used in mdz (e.g., 'Alert').
Value: import path (e.g., '$lib/Alert.svelte').

If mdz content references a component not in this map,
that Mdz usage is skipped (left as runtime).

If mdz content references an element not in this list,
that Mdz usage is skipped (left as runtime).

declarations.name: svelte_preprocess_mdz
declarations.doc_comment: Creates a Svelte preprocessor that compiles static `Mdz` content at build time.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Configuration for component/element resolution and file filtering.

modules.module_comment:
Svelte preprocessor that compiles static `Mdz` content to Svelte markup at build time.

Detects `Mdz` components with static string `content` props, parses the mdz content,
renders each `MdzNode` to equivalent Svelte markup via `mdz_to_svelte`, and replaces
the `Mdz` with `MdzPrecompiled` containing pre-rendered children.

Also handles ternary chains (`content={a ? 'x' : b ? 'y' : 'z'}`) where all leaf
values are statically resolvable strings, emitting `{#if a}markup_x{:else if b}markup_y{:else}markup_z{/if}`
as children of a single `MdzPrecompiled`.

Truly dynamic `content` props are left untouched.

props.name: fill
props.description: Overrides `data.fill`.

props.name: size
props.description: Sets both the `width` and `height` of the svg. Overridden by the `width` and `height` props.

props.name: width
props.description: Sets the `width` of the svg. Overrides `size`.

props.name: height
props.description: Sets the `height` of the svg. Overrides `size`.

props.name: inline
props.description: Renders the SVG as an inline block with spacing appropriate for text. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: to
props.description:
Defaults to `undefined` to lessen friction with SSR.
We may want to change this to optionally accept a string selector,
but that didn't seem to be the best API for the `Dialog`.

props.name: themer
props.description:
A reactive class containing the selected theme and color scheme.
Defaults to the first default theme.
The class reference is not reactive
because it's set in context without a wrapper, use `{#key theme}` if it changes.

props.name: children
props.type: Snippet<[themer: Themer, style: string | null, theme_style_html: string | null]>

modules.module_comment:
`Themed` adds global color scheme and theme support to the page.
It also sets in the Svelte context a reactive `themer` containing the theme and color scheme.

declarations.name: tsdoc_see_to_mdz
declarations.doc_comment:
Convert raw TSDoc `@see` content to mdz format for rendering.

Handles TSDoc link syntax:
- `|text` â†’ `[text](url)` (markdown link)
- `://...` â†’ `https://...` (bare URL, auto-linked by mdz)
- `` â†’ `` `identifier` `` (code formatting)
- Bare URLs â†’ returned as-is
- Bare identifiers â†’ wrapped in backticks

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Raw `@see` tag content in TSDoc format

modules.module_comment:
Bridge between TSDoc format and mdz for rendering.

This module converts raw TSDoc syntax (from the analysis library) to mdz format
(Fuz's documentation rendering dialect). It lives in fuz_ui, not the extracted
analysis library, to keep that library format-agnostic.

props.name: hash
props.description: URL fragment to append, with or without the `#`.

properties.name: library_path
properties.doc_comment: Path to the library.json file (relative to vite.config.ts).

declarations.name: vite_plugin_library_well_known
declarations.doc_comment:
Vite plugin that publishes `package.json` and `library.json` to `.well-known/`.

Requires a generated library.json file (created by `library_gen` from `gro gen`).
The plugin reads this JSON file and publishes its metadata to `.well-known/` for
both dev and production builds.

Note: This plugin respects SvelteKit's `base` path configuration, so `.well-known/`
will be served at `{base}.well-known/` (e.g., `/my-app/.well-known/`). This deviates
from RFC 8615 which specifies `.well-known` should be at the domain root. This tradeoff
allows the plugin to work correctly when apps are deployed to non-root paths.

Note: CORS headers are only set for the dev server. For production, configure
CORS at the server level (nginx, Caddy, etc.) if cross-origin access is needed.
